stream_context.summary: Kaze works in Fast64 on the overworld/volcano hub of Return to Yoshi's Island.  Focus is on blending rock textures, choosing new volcanic cliff materials, and planning grass transitions.  He also shows a public progress-tracker spreadsheet and reports on the first Course 4 beta test.

development_findings.summary: The sound engine has been completely rewritten; Kaze is now importing Badub’s new ambient SFX (propeller, windmill), which "adds so much" to the world.
development_findings.quote: Now that the sound engine is completely remade, we can add some sound effects everywhere.

development_findings.summary: First external beta of Course 4 ran; testers liked it more than expected, confirming design direction but exposing a soft-lock bug and an unpopular plane mission.
development_findings.quote: We finally got the first beta test for Course 4… The testers liked it more than I thought they would.

development_findings.summary: Plane mission in Course 4 will be re-designed; Kaze and Biobak brainstormed a ‘damage-control’ replacement concept.
development_findings.quote: The plane mission sucks.  We need to think of something new … I discussed this with Biobak already and I think we have a decent idea to damage control it.

development_findings.summary: Created and published a live Google-sheet progress tracker listing every course’s completion percentage; will update and tweet it regularly.
development_findings.quote: I put out an RTYI progress tracker… You can see how far along the game is.

development_findings.summary: Overworld visual pass: replaced generic cliff material with layered ‘volcanic’ rock on the lava side and non-volcanic stone elsewhere; will fade tops into grass for friendlier Yoshi aesthetic.
Fast64 lighting bug (yellow/red light issue) still unresolved; Kaze checked forum for fixes but none yet.
development_findings.quote: Nope, the bug is still there… Fast64 forum ­– nothing.

development_findings.summary: Overdrive (EverDrive) build currently crashes; Kaze intends to diagnose and fix before final build.
development_findings.quote: I do plan on figuring out why the Overdrive crashes… I’m feeling fairly confident that I can fix it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze warns that allowing flash-cart builds leads to unauthorized physical bootlegs; past hacks likely earned pirates "over a million dollars."
development_findings.quote: If I let people make flashable ROMs… people are going to make bootlegs of my game and sell them.

context_findings.summary: Kaze feels newly ‘free’ after several busy days; streaming is a return to preferred work on the hack.
context_findings.quote: I had so much stuff to do the last couple days… now I'm back into I can just do what I want mode.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes making YouTube videos but does it for financial stability, balancing time between content and development.
context_findings.quote: Do I like making videos? No, I hate making videos. But it's good money.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with constant release-date questions; publishes tracker to reduce repetitive queries.
context_findings.quote: With the mass of people asking that question, it is extremely annoying.

context_findings.summary: Shares personal workout routine and habit of touching random objects on stream; minor glimpse into daily life.

biobak.summary: Provides primary graphics/art reworks; upcoming re-pass may alter completed courses but is "mostly updating graphics" with minor, easy gameplay tweaks.
biobak.quote: Biobak rework is just him updating the graphics… He does make some gameplay changes, but they are all very simple to accommodate.

biobak.summary: Collaborating with Kaze on redesigning the problematic plane mission in Course 4.
Active in chat giving texture and rock advice during stream; Kaze defers to him as the 'rock expert.'

badub.summary: Supplying new sound effects; recent SFX imports (propeller, windmill) significantly improve ambience.
badub.quote: I recently started importing some of Badub's sound effects… it makes it feel so much more alive.

key_stories.title: Course 4 Beta Soft-lock
key_stories.summary: First external beta revealed a soft-lock and an underwhelming plane mission, prompting rapid redesign discussions.
key_stories.challenge: Players became stuck repeatedly and disliked the plane objective.
key_stories.process: Kaze collected feedback, met with Biobak to brainstorm a new concept.
key_stories.outcome: They have a ‘damage-control’ plan and expect up to three more beta rounds before declaring Course 4 finished.
key_stories.key_quote: There's one very frustrating bug – I kept getting soft-locked – and the plane mission sucks.

key_stories.title: Public Progress Tracker
key_stories.summary: Constant release-date questions pushed Kaze to publish a live spreadsheet showing per-course completion.
key_stories.challenge: Release-date spam was exhausting and unproductive.
key_stories.process: Built a Google Sheet detailing percentages and shared it on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Fans can self-check progress; Kaze plans regular updates and tweets.
key_stories.key_quote: Here, progress tracker… now there's no release date. It's going to release when it's done.

key_stories.title: Sound Engine Overhaul
key_stories.summary: A full rewrite of the audio engine unlocked richer environmental sounds.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy engine limited the placement of ambient SFX.
key_stories.process: Re-engineered sound system, collaborated with Badub to import new samples.
key_stories.outcome: Propeller and windmill loops now play in-game, boosting world feel.
key_stories.key_quote: Now that the sound engine is completely remade, we can add some sound effects everywhere.

open_questions.context: Kaze and Biobak have ‘a decent idea’ but no details given.
questions: What specific new objective or mechanics will replace the current plane mission?
How will the redesign prevent future soft-locks?
What feedback from testers guided the new concept?

open_questions.context: Final build presently crashes on EverDrive; Kaze hopes to fix.
questions: What symptoms or logs point to the crash cause?
Is it tied to memory, DMA, or new audio engine?
What is the fallback plan if Overdrive compatibility fails?

open_questions.context: Yellow/red light bug persists; waiting on tool authors.
questions: What exactly is the bug’s effect in-game?
Has the Fast64 team responded or provided workarounds?

open_questions.context: Multiple courses marked 75-98% but pending further Biobak passes.
questions: Which courses are guaranteed to change visually?
How late in development can graphic overhauls happen without breaking levels?

open_questions.context: Kaze worries about bootleg carts profiting off RTYI.
questions: Has the team considered legal statements or ROM encryption?
Would they ever sell official cartridges to pre-empt bootlegs?
